clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Self-Acupressure on Pain and Sleep in Coronary Artery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Self-Acupressure on Pain and Sleep in Coronary Artery Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to evaluate the effect of acupressure applied to patients with coronary artery disease (CAD) on pain and sleep quality.

detailed_description.textblock: Self-Acupressur application will improve pain and sleep quality in CAD.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is an experimental study with pre-test and post-test control groups

primary_outcome.description: The patients were asked to mark their level of pain during relaxation or activities on a 10 cm vertical or horizontal line. In addition, there were forms which were numbered from 1-10 or from 1-100. The number 0 is found at the beginning of the line, and the number 10 is located at the end of the line. value of 0 shows that there is no pain, and the value 10 expresses unendurable pain. VAS is a common scale in the assessment of pain level. A patient is asked to mark the perceived pain on this line, and the marked point is measured in cm

The patients were asked to mark their level of pain during relaxation or activities on a 10 cm vertical or horizontal line. In addition, there were forms which were numbered from 1-10 or from 1-100. The number 0 is found at the beginning of the line, and the number 10 is located at the end of the line. value of 0 shows that there is no pain, and the value 10 expresses unendurable pain. VAS is a common scale in the assessment of pain level. A patient is asked to mark the perceived pain on this line, and the marked point is measured in cm

The PSQI is a valid and consistent survey comprising of 19 questions to assess quality and amount of sleep and the existence of a sleep disorder and its level in the previous month. The scale was adapted into the Turkish language by Agargün et al. (1996). The scale consists of seven components that assess patients subjective sleep quality, sleep delay, use of sleeping medication and disfunction in daily activities. Each item scores in the range 0-3 points and the total score of the seven components gives the total PSQI score. The total score has a value between 0-21 and a high total score demonstrates a poor quality of sleep. A total PSQI score which is ≤5 indicates "good sleep", and a score which is >5 indicates "poor sleep"

The PSQI is a valid and consistent survey comprising of 19 questions to assess quality and amount of sleep and the existence of a sleep disorder and its level in the previous month. The scale was adapted into the Turkish language by Agargün et al. (1996). The scale consists of seven components that assess patients subjective sleep quality, sleep delay, use of sleeping medication and disfunction in daily activities. Each item scores in the range 0-3 points and the total score of the seven components gives the total PSQI score. The total score has a value between 0-21 and a high total score demonstrates a poor quality of sleep. A total PSQI score which is ≤5 indicates "good sleep", and a score which is >5 indicates "poor sleep"

arm_group.description: Self-Acupressure Each application to the acupressure points (HT 7, CV17,PC 6, LI4,SP 6) will be done in 2 minutes and right and left)

intervention.description: Acupressure is a therapy method performed with an instrument or hand, fingertip, palm, elbow, knee, thumb relaxation and wrist bands on various points representing the waist organs in order to ensure the continuation and balance of the energy in our body

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Not having a psychiatric diagnosis,
- To be able to communicate adequately
- Not having psychiatric problems
- Volunteering to participate in research
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Istanbul Sabahattin Zaim University, Faculty of Health Sciences

results_reference.citation: Narimani M, Ansari Jaberi A, Negahban Bonabi T, Sadeghi T. Effect of Acupressure on Pain Severity in Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Graft: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Anesth Pain Med. 2018 Oct 20;8(5):e82920. doi: 10.5812/aapm.82920. eCollection 2018 Oct.
